trans-unit.source: Creates a threshold filter that constrains values
trans-unit.target: Creates a threshold filter that constrains values

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Threshold Filter</ui> module to define a filter that restricts numeric values to a specified range.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Threshold Filter</ui> module to define a filter that restricts numeric values to a specified range.

trans-unit.source: A threshold filter is a filter commonly used in digital signal processing.
trans-unit.target: A threshold filter is a filter commonly used in digital signal processing.

trans-unit.source: It examines each value of the input dataset and changes all values that do not meet the boundary conditions.
trans-unit.target: It examines each value of the input dataset and changes all values that do not meet the boundary conditions.

trans-unit.source: You typically would use this type of filter for the following applications:
trans-unit.target: You typically would use this type of filter for the following applications:

trans-unit.source: Replace all negatively signed measurements with a value of zero.
trans-unit.target: Replace all negatively signed measurements with a value of zero.

trans-unit.source: Convert a gray-scale image to black and white areas by defining a numerical boundary value for all pixels.
trans-unit.target: Convert a gray-scale image to black and white areas by defining a numerical boundary value for all pixels.

trans-unit.source: After you have defined a filter that meets your needs, you can apply the filter to data by connecting a dataset and the filter to the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module.
trans-unit.target: After you have defined a filter that meets your needs, you can apply the filter to data by connecting a dataset and the filter to the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module.

trans-unit.source: The output of the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module is a dataset containing the selected columns, transformed as specified by the <ui>Threshold Filter</ui> settings.
trans-unit.target: The output of the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module is a dataset containing the selected columns, transformed as specified by the <ui>Threshold Filter</ui> settings.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, if you select the <ui>Indicator</ui> option, instead of returning the filter values, a column is returned containing Boolean values that indicates whether the value in each row met the specified filter condition or not.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, if you select the <ui>Indicator</ui> option, instead of returning the filter values, a column is returned containing Boolean values that indicates whether the value in each row met the specified filter condition or not.

trans-unit.source: Need to filter data from a dataset or remove missing values?
trans-unit.target: Need to filter data from a dataset or remove missing values?

trans-unit.source: Use this module to remove missing values or replace missing values with placeholders.
trans-unit.target: Use this module to remove missing values or replace missing values with placeholders.

trans-unit.source: Use this module to divide or filter your dataset by criteria such as a range of dates, a specific value, or regular expressions.
trans-unit.target: Use this module to divide or filter your dataset by criteria such as a range of dates, a specific value, or regular expressions.

trans-unit.source: Use this module to set a range and keep only the values within that range.
trans-unit.target: Use this module to set a range and keep only the values within that range.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a Threshold Filter
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a Threshold Filter

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can specify that an indicator column be created.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can specify that an indicator column be created.

trans-unit.source: An indicator column is useful when you are testing a new filter and want to verify that the filter is affecting only the target values.
trans-unit.target: An indicator column is useful when you are testing a new filter and want to verify that the filter is affecting only the target values.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the type of filter you create, there may be additional required parameters.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the type of filter you create, there may be additional required parameters.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.

trans-unit.source: Connect the filter to <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link>, and connect a dataset.
trans-unit.target: Connect the filter to <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link>, and connect a dataset.

trans-unit.source: Use the Column Selector to specify which columns the filter should be applied to.
trans-unit.target: Use the Column Selector to specify which columns the filter should be applied to.

trans-unit.source: By default, the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module will use the filter for all selected numeric columns.
trans-unit.target: By default, the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module will use the filter for all selected numeric columns.

trans-unit.source: No computations are performed until you connect a dataset to the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module and run the experiment.
trans-unit.target: No computations are performed until you connect a dataset to the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module and run the experiment.

trans-unit.source: At that point, the following operations are applied to the selected columns:
trans-unit.target: At that point, the following operations are applied to the selected columns:

trans-unit.source: For each set of values defined by the threshold criteria, the current (or index) value is replaced with the threshold.
trans-unit.target: For each set of values defined by the threshold criteria, the current (or index) value is replaced with the threshold.

trans-unit.source: For example, suppose you have a series of numbers, 10-13, and you create a threshold filter using the <ui>LessThan</ui> option and a level of 12.
trans-unit.target: For example, suppose you have a series of numbers, 10-13, and you create a threshold filter using the <ui>LessThan</ui> option and a level of 12.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the numbers 12 and 13 are not within the range defined by the less than criteria (values must be less than 12); therefore, the filter is not applied (indicator = FALSE) and the values stay as they are.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the numbers 12 and 13 are not within the range defined by the less than criteria (values must be less than 12); therefore, the filter is not applied (indicator = FALSE) and the values stay as they are.

trans-unit.source: Numbers that meet the filter criteria (less than 2) are flagged with TRUE in the indicator column and those values are replaced with the specified threshold or level value of 12.
trans-unit.target: Numbers that meet the filter criteria (less than 2) are flagged with TRUE in the indicator column and those values are replaced with the specified threshold or level value of 12.

trans-unit.source: You can customize the type of threshold filter that is applied, and the values used for replacement, by using these options:
trans-unit.target: You can customize the type of threshold filter that is applied, and the values used for replacement, by using these options:

trans-unit.source: Specify the type of threshold filter to apply:
trans-unit.target: Specify the type of threshold filter to apply:

trans-unit.source: Changes values that are less than the specified level to the boundary level, and passes through all other values.
trans-unit.target: Changes values that are less than the specified level to the boundary level, and passes through all other values.

trans-unit.source: Changes values that are greater than the specified level to the boundary level, and passes through all other values.
trans-unit.target: Changes values that are greater than the specified level to the boundary level, and passes through all other values.

trans-unit.source: Calculates the magnitude, and changes values with a magnitude less than the specified level to the boundary level.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the magnitude, and changes values with a magnitude less than the specified level to the boundary level.

trans-unit.source: Calculates the magnitude, and changes values with a magnitude greater than the specified level to the boundary level.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the magnitude, and changes values with a magnitude greater than the specified level to the boundary level.

trans-unit.source: Passes through all values that fall within the specified range, and changes values outside the range to the closest boundary value.
trans-unit.target: Passes through all values that fall within the specified range, and changes values outside the range to the closest boundary value.

trans-unit.source: Passes through all values that fall outside the specified range, and changes values inside the range to the closest boundary value.
trans-unit.target: Passes through all values that fall outside the specified range, and changes values inside the range to the closest boundary value.

trans-unit.source: Passes through all values that fall within the specified range of standard deviations, and changes values outside the range to the closest boundary value.
trans-unit.target: Passes through all values that fall within the specified range of standard deviations, and changes values outside the range to the closest boundary value.

trans-unit.source: Passes through all values that fall outside the specified range of standard deviations, and changes values inside the range to the closest boundary value.
trans-unit.target: Passes through all values that fall outside the specified range of standard deviations, and changes values inside the range to the closest boundary value.

trans-unit.source: Type the boundary values that you want to apply in each type of threshold.
trans-unit.target: Type the boundary values that you want to apply in each type of threshold.

trans-unit.source: Some filters require only a ceiling or floor value.
trans-unit.target: Some filters require only a ceiling or floor value.

trans-unit.source: Select this option to generate a new column that indicates whether the value would be affected by the filter.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to generate a new column that indicates whether the value would be affected by the filter.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, values in the column are replaced when you apply the filter.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, values in the column are replaced when you apply the filter.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you apply a threshold filter that specifies a range with a lower boundary of 2 and an upper boundary of 4, the filter returns these values:
trans-unit.target: For example, if you apply a threshold filter that specifies a range with a lower boundary of 2 and an upper boundary of 4, the filter returns these values:

trans-unit.source: Values within the specified range are left as is.
trans-unit.target: Values within the specified range are left as is.

trans-unit.source: Values beyond the specified range are replaced with the respective threshold values.
trans-unit.target: Values beyond the specified range are replaced with the respective threshold values.

trans-unit.source: If you leave <ui>Indicator</ui> unselected, the filter generates the replacement values in the right column.
trans-unit.target: If you leave <ui>Indicator</ui> unselected, the filter generates the replacement values in the right column.

trans-unit.source: For examples of how filters are used in machine learning, see this experiment in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how filters are used in machine learning, see this experiment in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Filters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525732</linkUri></externalLink> experiment demonstrates all filter types.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Filters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525732</linkUri></externalLink> experiment demonstrates all filter types.

trans-unit.source: The example uses an engineered waveform dataset to more easily illustrate the effects of the different filters.
trans-unit.target: The example uses an engineered waveform dataset to more easily illustrate the effects of the different filters.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Threshold Filter</ui> module uses the following methods to define threshold values, depending on the filter type:
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Threshold Filter</ui> module uses the following methods to define threshold values, depending on the filter type:

trans-unit.source: The less-than mode is defined as:
trans-unit.target: The less-than mode is defined as:

trans-unit.source: The less-than-magnitude mode is defined as:
trans-unit.target: The less-than-magnitude mode is defined as:

trans-unit.source: For complex inputs, the magnitude of each element is restricted as shown by this formula:
trans-unit.target: For complex inputs, the magnitude of each element is restricted as shown by this formula:

trans-unit.source: The greater than magnitude mode is defined as:
trans-unit.target: The greater than magnitude mode is defined as:

trans-unit.source: For complex inputs, the magnitude of each element is restricted as shown by this formula:
trans-unit.target: For complex inputs, the magnitude of each element is restricted as shown by this formula:

trans-unit.source: Select the threshold method to use
trans-unit.target: Select the threshold method to use

trans-unit.source: Select this option to return a column that contains a True/False indication of whether the value met the filter condition, rather than the filtered values.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to return a column that contains a True/False indication of whether the value met the filter condition, rather than the filtered values.

trans-unit.source: Specify the lower boundary of the range
trans-unit.target: Specify the lower boundary of the range

trans-unit.source: Specify the upper boundary of the range
trans-unit.target: Specify the upper boundary of the range

trans-unit.source: Use this value, multiplied by the calculated standard deviation, as the threshold
trans-unit.target: Use this value, multiplied by the calculated standard deviation, as the threshold
